ygData.subject: RE: Deleting /friend list (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: It appears that your friends list is located in the eqOptions1.opt file. I m uncertain what would happen if you were to remove the file, but I would assume it
ygData.messageBody:
It appears that your friends list is located in the eqOptions1.opt file. I'm
uncertain what would happen if you were to remove the file, but I would
assume it would rebuild it. Your hot keys appear to be in your
"charactername.opt" file, so I would not recommend touching that.

Of course, according to Verant's policy, they might consider this a hack, so
you're up to your own on whether you want to try this.

--Windleaf


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 4:26 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Deleting /friend list (OT)
>
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> Is there anyway to delete your entire /friend list and start
> over? I typed
> in /friend to see who all was listed on there that I hadn't
> seen in a long
> time. I noticed that there were a couple of phrases listed
> in addition to
> players. Apparently I thought I was sending a /tell, /say,
> or /groupsay but
> instead I hit "/f" instead of "/t" so I ended up adding the
> phrase I typed
> to my friend list. When I type in /friend and get the entire
> list, there are
> a few blank spaces in front of the phrases. I have made
> numerous attempts
> at removing the phrase by adding one, two, three, etc spaces
> before I type
> in any letters. All this does is add another phrase to my
> friend list.
>
> I thinking if I delete my characters .opt file in the EQ
> directory this will
> delete my friends list as well as all my hotkeys. Will this work? My
> friends list is full so I need to free up the slots.
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
